goals.question: What is the distribution of goals scored by teams in the league?
goals.visualization: Histogram of goals scored by teams
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of goals scored by teams in the league and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the correlation between the number of passes made and the number of goals scored by a team?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of number of passes made vs number of goals scored
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a relationship between the number of passes made and the number of goals scored by a team.

goals.question: What is the distribution of player salaries in the league?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of player salaries in the league and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the distribution of yellow and red cards given to players in the league?
goals.visualization: Stacked bar chart of yellow and red cards given to players
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of yellow and red cards given to players in the league.

goals.question: What is the distribution of the number of fouls committed by teams in the league?
goals.visualization: Histogram of number of fouls committed by teams
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of fouls committed by teams in the league and identify any outliers.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['goals'] = data['goals'].astype(int)
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='goals', kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.axvline(data['goals'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Mean')
    plt.axvline(data['goals'].median(), color='green', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Median')
    plt.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of goals scored by teams in the league?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['goals'] = pd.to_numeric(data['goals'], errors='coerce')
    data['passes'] = pd.to_numeric(data['passes'], errors='coerce')
    chart = sns.scatterplot(x='passes', y='goals', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the correlation between the number of passes made and the number of goals scored by a team?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['salary'] = data['salary'].astype(float)
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='salary', kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.axvline(data['salary'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Median Salary: {:.2f}'.format(data['salary'].median()))
    plt.title('What is the distribution of player salaries in the league?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['cards'] = data['yellowCards'] + data['redCards']
    cards_data = data[['cards', 'yellowCards', 'redCards']].groupby('cards').count().reset_index()
    cards_data = pd.melt(cards_data, id_vars=['cards'], value_vars=['yellowCards', 'redCards'])
    cards_data.rename(columns={'variable': 'card_type', 'value': 'count'}, inplace=True)
    sns.barplot(x='cards', y='count', hue='card_type', data=cards_data)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of yellow and red cards given to players in the league?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['fouls'] = data['fouls'].astype(int)
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='fouls', kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.axvline(data['fouls'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Mean')
    plt.axvline(data['fouls'].median(), color='green', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Median')
    plt.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of the number of fouls committed by teams in the league?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
